dlgLine.text: How can I help?

dlgAnsw.text: Can I ask you a question?
We'll talk later.

dlgLine.text: Of course.

dlgAnsw.text: Where am I?
What can you tell me about the people here?
What can you tell me about what's going on?
We'll talk later.

dlgLine.text: <You wake up to the sound of people arguing. Your body is stiff and you can smell the unmistakable scent of rubbing alcohol. You feel like you've been sleeping off a horrible fever.>
<The last thing you remember is the plane going down.>
Food? Who cares about food when we’ve got a huge hole in that fence! If we don’t fix it, they’re going to walk right in here!
I know, Mom – but who’s going to risk going out there? You? Me? Joel?
I suppose I should be the one to go, being the cop and all. Kinda be nice if someone was watchin' my back.
Not my Renee - that's for damn sure!
<Davis looks at you> You're up? You probably have a million questions and I realize you’re still healing from your injuries, but frankly, we could really use your help.

dlgAnsw.text: Who are you people?
Sure. What do you need me to do?
I guess. What are we doing?

dlgLine.text: We're... friends. You're in a school in Splendid, Texas-
I'm sorry - I know you just woke up, but the explanation is going to have to wait.
I'll tell you more later. So... you think you can help us out? If you're up to it.

dlgAnsw.text: I'll try.
Do I have much of a choice?

dlgLine.text: The fence around the school was being refinished when the town was evacuated. There's whole sections missing, which-
I've seen what's out there - we're not safe. If those things find out we're inside...
If we want to move into the school upstairs, we're going to have to finish that fence. It's not completely down - with the proper supplies, we could fix it in a day.
Can't get very far - we drained the fuel in the cars to power the generator.
There's a hardware store over in Llano. It's a bit of a walk, but it's our best bet.
You're going to want to bring back a toolbox and as many spare parts as you can. Getting that fence up is our only option.

dlgAnsw.text: I can do that.
Wait - just two of us? There's strength in numbers - someone else has to come.
What kind of backwater town doesn't have a goddamn hardware store?!

dlgLine.text: It has its charms.
We used to have a frozen yogurt place... 'til the sinkhole.

dlgAnsw.text: Fine. Let's just get this over with.
I'll go, but someone else is coming with us.

dlgLine.text: Um... You know, I'd feel a bit better about this if we had a third person. I still remember the last time we went outside of Splendid...

dlgAnsw.text: - New Answ -

dlgLine.text: We're going to need someone to stay here and help me secure the windows and doors upstairs. But I can't volunteer anyone else.
Don't even think about taking my Renee. There's no way I'm letting my little girl go out there!
Mom, please - I can take care of myself. And what if someone gets hurt? I'm the only one here with any medical training.
Take me if you have to - I don't want to have to fight, but you don't drive a big rig for ten years without learning how to bust some heads.
Oh, no you don't, Mom. If anything happened to you...

dlgAnsw.text: I need a medic - Renee's coming with us.
I need someone who can fight - Anita, you're going with us.

dlgLine.text: If anything happens to her... I'm holding you personally responsible - understand?!

dlgAnsw.text: - New Answ -

dlgLine.text: Don't take my mom! Can't you just... <sigh>

dlgAnsw.text: - New Answ -

dlgLine.text: Okay, it's decided. You three go to the hardware store in Llano and get a toolbox and all the parts you can carry. We'll secure the school's first floor while you're gone.

dlgAnsw.text: Understood. Let's go.
You all better not get me killed.

dlgLine.text: You're in Texas - a town called Splendid. They evacuated the town, so we're all that's left. It's a long story... we should talk about this when we have more time.

dlgAnsw.text: I have another question.
That's all I needed to know. See ya.

dlgLine.text: Joel and I are locals. Joel's a police officer and I've worked here at the school. Anita and Renee ran out of gas not far from here - I picked up their distress call on the radio.
The other woman, that's Elaine. She's been through a lot. Maybe you should try talking to her.
Just be patient - they're a lot stronger than you think.

dlgAnsw.text: I have another question.
I see. I should go.

dlgLine.text: Outside - it's not safe anymore. Everything's changed.
You'll see... And when you do, don't think twice about killing one if it's you or them.

dlgAnsw.text: Right... Another question.
I should go.

dlgLine.text: We should begin repairing the fence today. Do you have the supplies?

dlgAnsw.text: Yes. We found everything we need.
No. It was too dangerous to bring anything back.

dlgLine.text: Hmm... I understand, but we really need to get that fence repaired. Every day it's down, we're all at risk.
Despite the danger, I don't know of any other way. You should probably give it another try...

dlgAnsw.text: Why don't you go?!
I'll see what I can do.

dlgLine.text: I would if I could...
This isn't something we can argue about. You've seen the danger out there - if we don't get the fence up, we have nowhere else to go.

dlgAnsw.text: I'll try to get those materials.
I can do it. Just not happy about it.

dlgLine.text: Great, we should get that task assigned to some people here. I've put up a task board in the cafeteria. You should assign people to jobs so they know what they should be doing.
I'll make sure we keep track of everyone's progress so we can manage this place efficiently.
For now, you should assign some people to repair the fence since we have the necessary components. It's not a very complicated task, so anyone should be up to it.

We'll only be able to work during daylight hours, so keep that in mind. That fence is our top priority - if anything happens to it, everyone here is at risk. As long as we keep it up, people won't worry about it.

dlgAnsw.text: Understood, I'll go take a look at the task board.
Let's hope they know how to follow directions.

dlgLine.text: Also, if you have any spare parts left, you may want to try and get that abandoned well on the property operational again. A source of fresh water could definitely help boost morale around here.

dlgAnsw.text: Good idea. I'll look into it.
I have something else planned, but I'll think about it.

dlgLine.text: I'm glad you made it back. I can only imagine what it was like out there.
We've been keeping supplies in the backroom near the basement. If you have the parts for the fence, feel free to put them on the shelf and I'll organize everything.
Anyway, you must be tired. We set up a bed for you in one of the classrooms upstairs. Go get some rest - we'll talk more in the morning.

dlgAnsw.text: Thanks. I could use some sleep.
I don't think I can sleep much after today. I'll try... See ya.
